Summary: 8-12 lights that were high up flew from all directions over Waterford/Pontiac and put on a show.
trends: There have been 7 other sightings in Waterford
There were no other sightings in Waterford on or around September 9th 2008
divs: sighting detailsi have walked my dog every night since 2006. around 10-10:30pm every evening i could look up and see one to four or even five lights by the time i got home. these lights would fly fishlike at times. real squiggly. they would come from any direction. sometimes they flew up, down or around and would go from horizon to another edge of the horizon. sometimes they would fly to this one triangular point and disappear. one time was very dramatic. there were clouds and there were clear patches. where it was clear, you could see the stars. when these star looking lights would start to move, they flew into and out of the clouds. there were three or four and on this occasion they flew into a cloud and there was a huge light explosion. no sound, just tremendous flashing inside the cloud. they never came back out that night. but, they were back the next night. this had gone on for several summers and i always checked the paper to see if any one ever saw them besides me. i tried to call the airport to the atc tower but couldn't get anyone to answer. on a sunday night in sept.(2,9,16,23,30) 2007 or 2008, i took my dog to the donelson playground on the corner of m-59 and coleman. they tore the school down and it's just a huge field. as i walked daisy towards cvs drugstore i kept looking up. this time i saw 2 lights come from the ne and 2- come from the n and three come from the nw and several more come from the se and two or three come from the w. they converged over my head, still high up, and put on a mobility show is all i can think to call it. it was really something to watch. they'd fly into each other and then split up. then fly outwards, to the circular area of the night sky you can see, going in all directions at once. then back they'd come into a very small area above me again. i have always wondered how many others saw that. it just isn't possible that i was the only one. later on that fall, again on a sunday i saw one light flying fast first n to s then right back the same path it had just come only it hung a left (w) so quick and then i saw why. two military jets were chasing it. this was about 9:30-10:00 pm on a sunday night. well, after that incident i didn't see them all that often. i do know the difference between satelites and airplanes or those huge spotlights they use to bring attention to store openings or a carnival. i had others come and see these lights. it was no big deal to locate them on any given night. i never knew how to look into it until today whike watching channel 25(discovery channel). it was a program that mufon had looked into about a guy named bledsoe. anyway, i tried mufon.com and up you popped. it has been so long since these events transpired that i might have the weekday mixed up about the light show over the playground. but, the two jets chasing the one light was on a sunday late in the summer\fall. it was sept or early oct. i didn't go out during the winter to walk the dog but i did go out to look for the lights. funny, it's like they don't like the winter all that much either. very scarce on the light sightings. maybe two or three in a ten day period. i was so used to them it just wasn't a big deal any more. other people i showed them to saw them and knew they were under someone's or somethings control. they just didn't fly in a straight line of any sort. i showed at least four or five people who all saw them. actually, i don't need confirmation (i know what i saw) just want to talk with others who saw them, too. this last summer i was hard pressed to see even three or four all season. they sure were fun, tho. so, if you know of anyone who would like to talk about them or if you know anything further about them, i sure would be interested! thanks, juanita rutledge
